summary:
I am driven by new technologies and nature. I love tinkering with new tools and methods as well as being out in nature. Where these two meet I can best apply my skills and find my passion.

I am good at scripting, image processing, and modelling. I mainly script in R and am working at strengthening my Python skills. I know my way around several GIS tools (QGIS, ArcGIS, Google Earth, FME Workbench) and know their limits. I can work with neural networks (Tensorflow, Keras) and apply classification methods.

In the founding and leading of a company I’ve had to learn fast how to manage projects and teams. This has been strengthened by working as a freelancer (GIS and EO analysis and consulting), where I learned from others. As a freelancer my main projects are quick feasibility studies with relations to satellite data, analysing (high resolution) data, database design, data visualization and giving workshops to different stakeholders on the usability of EO data. 

I am always looking for new places to apply my skills, and new methods and challenges.

projects.title: ESA BIC App Camp, Noordwijk
projects.description:
Winner of the ESA Appathon in pre-selection in the Netherlands, for the SAP Challenge: Big Geo Data to maximise asset utilisation while reducing environmental, health and safety risks. 

The event included:
- Briefings about ESA and the Earth observation programme Copernicus
- Introduction to the SAP HANA Cloud Platform
- Development of an app concept
- Evaluation of further steps towards realising this concept and a corresponding business plan
- Presentation of the app concept to a jury

contributors.headline: Founder & Creator at Void & Visual + Sustainable Solutions Designer at Sobolt

profile_positions.description:
In Space4Good I focus on optical remote sensing, with Lidar processing where required. Within the projects I work closely together with Radar and Lidar specialists to combine data sources and provide most added value. I work on the full data flow, from data acquisition and processing to product development, and customer interviews. Next to this I take care of project management.
The main project I work on is reforestation in Indonesia, providing information based on satellite and drone data to people in the field. With this information they can monitor more efficiently, and improve management (eg. Early warning for illegal logging and fire detection, monitoring vegetation growth and providing species maps in complex tropical forests).
profile_positions.title: Remote Sensing Specialist

profile_positions.description: This application is a space-based solution for global insect related forest damage, which uses earth observation data from the Sentinel Satellites.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Studied 
Master: Forest and Nature Conservation
Master: Geo Information Sciences

My thesis topics:
Agent based modelling of recreationists in nature areas
Activities include: tracking of people, agent based modelling, spatial analysis, scientific writing

The effect of light on path selection of thick tailed bushbabies
Activities include: 3 months of field work abroad, tracking using GPS and radio signals, GIS analysis, scientific writing, developing data collection app

Other large projects: Ecosystem services for the rural poor (literature review), tracking waste in the canals of Amsterdam, the effect of light on nocturnal lemurs.

I have been student assistent for the course Argumentation Skills. Here, my resposibilities included organizing presentation and feedback sessions, chairing feedback sessions and grading papers
profile_positions.title: Msc Student

profile_positions.description:
The IFSOW is the International Forestry Students Organisation Wageningen. Each year, the IFSOW organises several events, including an international travel.

President

I have been president of the IFSOW in the period September 2012 – September 2013. As president I was responsible for:
•	Attending meetings of study association
•	Preparing and presiding meetings of IFSOW (4 – 8 commissioners) 
•	Organizing activities, including travels and parties

__

Treasurer 

In the period September 2013 – November 2014  was treasurer for the International Forestry Students Organisation Wageningen. As a treasurer I was responsible for:
•	Making year round budget (yearly budget approx. €2300)
•	Making activity budgets
•	Holding the organisation to the budget
•	Creating a funding plan, including sponsors
profile_positions.title: President and Treasurer

profile_positions.description:
I participated in a student delegation to the IUFRO World Congress in Salt Lake City and the organisation of a delegation from my university to this congress. Activities included: 

•	Speaker ready room: welcoming speakers and helping with the last minute preparations of presentations
•	Tour assistant: Help with a field tour, making sure all participants got back to the buss on time and doing head counts
•	IFSA activities: I participated and volunteered during various activities of the International Forestry Students’ Association (IFSA), such as networking e	vents and promotion activities
profile_positions.title: Student volunteer at IUFRO World Congress

profile_positions.description:
Head of promotion and communication commission (August 2013 – September 2014)

I was the head of the Promotion and Communication Commission of the IFSA. The IFSA is a large, worldwide organisation with 73 member organisations in 54 countries. I was responsible for (among others):
•	Website: end responsible for the creation of a new website, and updates of the current one
•	Creation of promotional materials, such as posters, flyers, and presentations
•	Running the commission and keeping members focussed and enthusiastic

___

Member of IUFRO World Conference Commission (August 2012 – October 2014)

With a commission in the International Forestry Students’ Association we prepared a delegation of over 40 students from all over the world to attend the world conference.

___

Organiser NERM (September 2011 -  September 2012) 

I was part of the organisation of the Northern European Regional Meeting (NERM) for the International Forestry Students Association (IFSA). For this meeting we hosted 48 people. My responsibilities included:
•	Co-responsible for acquiring funds, both sponsoring from small companies and larger funds (e.g. EU, University funds)
•	Arrange location
•	Organise and five tour in local nature area
•	Organise lecture and discussion evening
profile_positions.title: Various positions

volunteer_experiences.description: The work included teaching elementary school children about wildlife and wildlife conservation and working directly with wildlife. The course included lectures and practical sessions about products from nature, cultural attitude towards nature, wildlife identification and the handling and conservation of wildlife.

volunteer_experiences.role: Student volunteer at IUFRO World Congress

I participated in a student delegation to the IUFRO World Congress in Salt Lake City and the organisation of a delegation from my university to this congress. Activities included: 

•	Speaker ready room: welcoming speakers and helping with the last minute preparations of presentations
•	Tour assistant: Help with a field tour, making sure all participants got back to the buss on time and doing head counts
